title: Section 57: of the Corporations Tax Act (Ontario) or
enhanced_content:
## Ontario Media Production Tax Credits

### Ontario Computer Animation and Special Effects (OCASE) Tax Credit

#### Eligibility Requirements
- Must be a Canadian corporation with a permanent establishment in Ontario
- Cannot be exempt from tax under Part III of the Taxation Act, 2007 (Ontario) or Part I of the federal Income Tax Act
- Cannot be a prescribed labour-sponsored venture capital corporation at any time in the tax year

#### Labour Expenditure Requirements
For productions with specified labour costs before March 26, 2024:
- Must have a certificate for Ontario Production Services Tax Credit or Ontario Film and Television Tax Credit

For productions with no specified labour costs before March 26, 2024:
- Must incur minimum $25,000 in Ontario labour expenditures for each production
- This threshold can be met either in the current tax year or cumulatively between current and previous tax year

**Example:** A corporation incurs $15,000 in Ontario labour expenditures in 2024 and $12,000 in 2023 for the same production. The $25,000 threshold is met cumulatively, making expenditures from both years eligible.

#### Excluded Productions
- Instructional videos
- Music videos
- Gaming videos
- Videos consisting mainly of user-generated footage

#### Application Process
1. Apply online to Ontario Creates for a certificate of eligibility
2. Ontario Creates will issue a certificate indicating the estimated tax credit amount
3. Only one certificate is issued for all eligible productions in the tax year

#### Claiming the Credit
File with your T2 return:
- Certificate of eligibility (or copy) from Ontario Creates
- Completed Schedule 554 for each eligible production
- Enter total credit amount on line 456 of Schedule 5

### Ontario Film and Television Tax Credit

#### Credit Rates
**First-time Production:**
- 40% of labour expenditures for first $240,000, then 35% on balance
- Additional 10% for regional Ontario productions

**Small First-time Production:**
- Lesser of labour expenditures or:
  - $20,000 for regional Ontario productions
  - $15,000 for non-regional productions
- Total labour expenditure cannot exceed $50,000

**Example:** A small first-time production in Toronto (non-regional) with $30,000 in labour expenditures would qualify for a $15,000 credit.

**Other than First-time Production:**
- 35% of labour expenditures
- Additional 10% for regional Ontario productions

#### Eligibility Requirements
- Canadian-controlled corporation throughout the tax year (as defined in sections 26-28 of the Investment Canada Act)
- Permanent establishment in Ontario throughout the tax year
- Primarily engaged in Canadian film or video production business through a permanent establishment in Canada
- Not exempt from tax under Part III of the Taxation Act, 2007 (Ontario) or Part I of the federal Income Tax Act
- Not controlled by persons with taxable income exempt from tax under Part I of the federal Income Tax Act
- Not a prescribed labour-sponsored venture capital corporation

#### Application Process
1. Apply online to Ontario Creates for a certificate of eligibility
2. Ontario Creates will issue a certificate indicating the estimated tax credit amount

#### Claiming the Credit
File with your T2 return for each eligible production:
- Certificate of eligibility (or copy) or Letter of Confirmation from Ontario Creates
- Completed Schedule 556
- Enter total credit amount on line 458 of Schedule 5

### Ontario Production Services Tax Credit

#### Credit Rate
- 21.5% of qualifying production expenditures
- Includes qualifying labour expenditures and purchase/rental of qualifying tangible properties

**Example:** A corporation with $100,000 in qualifying production expenditures would be eligible for a $21,500 tax credit.

#### Eligibility Requirements
- Primarily engaged in film or video production business or production services business through a permanent establishment in Ontario
- Not exempt from tax under Part III of the Taxation Act, 2007 (Ontario) or Part I of the Income Tax Act
- Not controlled by persons with taxable income exempt from tax under Part I of the Income Tax Act
- Not a prescribed labour-sponsored venture capital corporation

#### Expenditure Requirements
- Ontario labour expenditures must be at least 25% of total qualifying production expenditures
- Otherwise, qualifying production expenditure limit cannot exceed four times Ontario labour expenditures
- Only expenditures incurred after final script stage to end of post-production stage are eligible

**Example:** If a corporation has $50,000 in Ontario labour expenditures, the maximum qualifying production expenditures would be $200,000 (4 Ã— $50,000).

#### Application Process
1. Apply online to Ontario Creates for a certificate of eligibility
2. Ontario Creates will issue a certificate indicating the estimated tax credit amount

#### Claiming the Credit
File with your T2 return for each eligible production:
- Certificate of eligibility (or copy) from Ontario Creates
- Completed Schedule 558
- Enter total credit amount on line 460 of Schedule 5

### Ontario Interactive Digital Media Tax Credit

#### Credit Rates
**Non-specified products (developed and marketed by corporation):**
- 40% of expenditures
- Includes marketing and distribution expenditures up to $100,000 per product

**Specified products (developed under fee-for-service arrangement):**
- 35% of expenditures

**Digital game corporations:**
- 35% credit for qualifying digital game corporations with minimum $1 million Ontario labour expenditures over 36 months
- 35% credit for specialized digital game corporations with at least $500,000 Ontario labour expenses annually

#### Eligibility Requirements
- Canadian corporation
- Completed development at permanent establishment in Ontario
- Not exempt from tax under Part III of the Taxation Act, 2007 (Ontario)
- Not controlled by corporations with taxable income exempt from tax

#### COVID-19 Temporary Measure
For products not completed before March 15, 2020, with eligible labour expenditures in 2020:
- 37-month period for incurring eligible labour expenditures extended by additional 24 months

#### Claiming the Credit
File with your T2 return:
- Certificate of eligibility (or copy) from Ontario Creates
- Completed Schedule 560

## General Filing Information

### Electronic Filing
- Use T2 Attach-a-doc for submitting required documentation

### Paper Filing
- Send return and attachments to your tax center
- Find your tax center at canada.ca/cra-tso-contact-information

### Processing Notes
- CRA will not begin processing media tax credit claims until all required documents are received
- A claim is considered complete when all documents are filed with CRA

### On-screen Acknowledgement Requirement
All productions must provide on-screen acknowledgement of Ontario's support in end credits if principal photography started after August 24, 2023.

### Online Distribution Eligibility
Productions distributed only online are eligible for credits if principal photography started on or after November 1, 2022, and they meet all applicable criteria.

### Mutual Exclusivity Rules
- Cannot claim Ontario Film and Television Tax Credit and Ontario Production Services Tax Credit for the same production
- Cannot claim Ontario Interactive Digital Media Tax Credit together with OCASE, Ontario Film and Television Tax Credit, or Ontario Production Services Tax Credit for the same expenditures
